document_title: Vaginitis: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_content:
Vulvitis is an inflammation of the soft skin on the outside of the female genitalia. The wet and warm nature of the vulva is the ideal condition for bacteria to invade, making this area susceptible to infection.
Any woman is susceptible to vulvovaginitis. However, people who are susceptible to allergies, sensitivities, and infections have a higher risk of infection. In addition, pubertal girls and postmenopausal women have low estrogen levels, so they are also susceptible to vulvovaginitis.
When you see symptoms such as itching, redness, burning, swelling, pain, abnormal vaginal discharge... you should see a doctor immediately.
subsection_title: viem am dao.json. What is vulvovaginitis?
